events.message: The customer reported a car accident that happened last night resulting in front-end damage to the vehicle.
Based on the report, the claim was classified under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage further communications and assist with next steps.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining expected timelines for processing.
The agent requested accident photographs, repair estimates, and a copy of the police report to proceed with the investigation.
The customer uploaded the required photos, repair bills, and police report as requested by the claims team.
Investigation into the vehicle collision began, including verification of submitted documents and accident circumstances.
Investigation concluded confirming damages were consistent with the collision described in the claim.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car expenses was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the offer and speed of service.
Claim approval was granted following customer acceptance of the settlement proposal and full documentation review.
Payment was disbursed to the customerâ€™s account covering all approved damages and agreed compensation.
The insurance claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and customer satisfaction.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
